word: I have been instructed that no hindrance should be placed in the way of Sister Starr's work for the W. C. T. U. . . . Let no hand be stretched out to hinder her in her work. Give her an opportunity to bring this message before the temperance organization. Letter 274, 1907, pp. 1, 2. (To Elder J. A. Burden, September 2, 1907.)
